intro: Psychotria gabonica, commonly known as the hooded or sacred plant, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and striking, hood-shaped flowers. The plant contains various alkaloids, including tetrahydrocannabinol (THC), which contributes to its psychoactive properties. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Due to its unique chemical composition, it has been studied for its potential medicinal and recreational uses.
